Comment: You're thinking of due process rights in regard to criminal charges, which most immigration cases are not. For non-criminal cases, your rights are much more limited (not saying this is right, just that it is) often as little as a hearing after arrest and before deportation. More importantly there are legal pathways, that were put in place by Bill Clinton in '96, expanded under Bush and further expanded under Trump term 1 to remove people without *any* hearing.  Do you really think that a system in place for almost 30 years is completely unconstitutional? Don't you think that this would have been successfully defeated in court during those 29 years?  Hate to pull the whataboutism card, but if this is truly and patently unjust, why did Clinton implement it, GW Bush expand it, Obama use it, among other methods, to deport record numbers under his watch, Trumps expansion wasn't shot down in court and Biden do nothing but reverse the Trump expansion of that process rather than the 96 foundation? And the whole time the underlying principle of a no hearing deportation stayed in place with no meaningful challenges in the courts.  Now lets fast forward to this Judge. She's dealing with a criminal case against the man, completely separate from his immigration issues. ICE shows up to serve a valid deportation/arrest warrant. They are instructed to wait until after the hearing to detain him. Instead she helps him sneak out through a employees only exit.  That simply isn't legal, and if anyone should understand that perfectly its a judge. You're intentionally stopping agents of the government from doing their duty. She had no reason to believe that his rights would be violated, and even if that was the case, helping him escape wasn't a legal way to advocate for him.  It's a reasonable concern that the Alien and Sedition Act deportations will be struck down in court and they are ultimately a violation of due process-- this case isn't that though.
